AttackerCapabilities: Knowledge of Git version control system
Knowledge of SQL and database manipulation

Vulnerabilities: Exposure of admin page and .git directory
Storage of passwords in MD5 and bcrypt hashes
SecurityMeasures: Properly secure admin page and .git directory
Use stronger hash algorithms for password storage

Steps.Description: The attacker uses the GitTools tool to dump the contents of the .git directory on the target website.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the .git directory may contain sensitive information or files that could be useful for further exploitation.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker runs the GitTools tool to dump the contents of the .git directory on the target website.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully obtains the contents of the .git directory.

Steps.Description: The attacker uses an extractor tool to retrieve files from the dumped .git directory.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the dumped .git directory may contain important files that could be useful for further exploitation.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses an extractor tool to retrieve files from the dumped .git directory.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully retrieves files from the dumped .git directory.

Steps.Description: The attacker identifies two users.db files within the retrieved files, one containing bcrypt hashes and the other containing MD5 hashes.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the users.db files may contain credentials or other sensitive information.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker identifies the presence of two users.db files within the retrieved files.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully identifies two users.db files, one containing bcrypt hashes and the other containing MD5 hashes.

Steps.Description: The attacker cracks the MD5 hashes to obtain the plaintext passwords.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that cracking the MD5 hashes will reveal valid plaintext passwords.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses a password cracking technique to crack the MD5 hashes and obtain the plaintext passwords.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully cracks the MD5 hashes and obtains a valid plaintext password: aaron@cgau.sdc.tf : weakpassword.

Steps.Description: The attacker logs in using the obtained valid credentials on the admin.html page.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that logging in with the valid credentials will provide access to the admin functionalities and potentially reveal the flag.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker logs in using the obtained valid credentials on the admin.html page.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully logs in and obtains the flag.
